Fury Cutter.Description: A BUG-type attack that grows more powerful with every hit. Returns to normal if it misses.

Leech Life.Description: An HP-draining attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Megahorn.Description: A BUG-type attack that uses a stiff horn or horns. It is rarely learned.

Pin Missile.Description: An attack that fires many needle-like projectiles from the body. Strikes several times.

Spider Web.Description: Sticky strings that prevent the target from escaping until the attacking Pokémon is gone.

String Shot.Description: Strings are sprayed out and wrapped around the target to reduce its SPEED.

Twineedle.Description: An attack that strikes twice. The target may occasionally become poisoned.

Beat Up.Description: A DARK-type attack. The user's fellow party Pokémon appear to pummel the target.

Bite.Description: A bite made using sharp fangs. This may cause the opponent to flinch, and it might not attack.

Crunch.Description: A DARK-type attack. Has a one-in-five chance of reducing the target's SPCL.DEF.

Faint Attack.Description: A DARK-type attack. The move catches the opponent off guard, so it never misses.

Pursuit.Description: A DARK-type attack. It inflicts major damage if the target switches out in the same turn.

Thief.Description: A DARK-type attack. The attacking Pokémon may steal an item held by the target.

Dragon Rage.Description: A DRAGON-type attack. It always inflicts a set amount of damage.

DragonBreath.Description: A DRAGON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target.

Outrage.Description: An attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker will become confused.

Twister.Description: A DRAGON-type attack. Has a one-in-five chance of causing the target to flinch.

Spark.Description: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target.

Thunder.Description: Strongest of all ELECTRIC-type attacks. Has a one-in-ten shot at paralyzing the target.

Thunder Wave.Description: A special move that causes paralysis. The victim has a onein-four chance of immobility.

ThunderPunch.Description: A special ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten shot at paralyzing the target.

Thundershock.Description: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Thunderbolt.Description: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Zap Cannon.Description: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Inaccurate but is guaranteed to cause paralysis if it hits.

Counter.Description: A retaliation move that pays back double the damage of a physical attack. Very accurate.

Cross Chop.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. It is powerful and often lands a critical hit.

Detect.Description: Allows user to completely evade attack. If used consecutively, its success rate decreases.

Double Kick.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. As the name implies, it is actually two quick kicks in succession.

DynamicPunch.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. Inaccurate but guaranteed to confuse the opponent if it hits.

Hi Jump Kick.Description: Stronger than JUMP KICK. If it misses, the attacker takes 1/8 the damage it would've caused.

Jump Kick.Description: A forceful FIGHTING-type attack. If it misses, however, the attacker gets hurt.

Karate Chop.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. Often turns into a critical hit and inflicts double the damage.

Low Kick.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it hits.

Mach Punch.Description: An incredibly fast punch that always lands first.

Reversal.Description: An attack that increases in power if the user's HP is low. It could turn the tide in battle.

Rock Smash.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. In the field, it can be used to shatter rocks to open new paths.

Rolling Kick.Description: A sharp FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three shot at making the target flinch.

Seismic Toss.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. Throws the target with enough force to flip the world.

Submission.Description: Strongest FIGHTING attack. One quarter of the damage also hurts the attacker.

Triple Kick.Description: A three-kick attack that inflicts increasing damage. When one kick misses, the move ends.

Vital Throw.Description: A FIGHTING-type attack. Always comes after the target's attack but never misses.

Ember.Description: A FIRE-type attack. Has a onein-ten chance of leaving the target with a damaging burn.

Fire Blast.Description: Strongest FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

Fire Punch.Description: A special FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

Fire Spin.Description: A FIRE-type attack that lasts two to five turns. The flames make the target unable to move.

Flame Wheel.Description: A FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

Flamethrower.Description: A powerful FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target with a burn.

Sacred Fire.Description: A FIRE-type attack. Has a onein-two chance of leaving the target with a burn.

Sunny Day.Description: Makes the weather sunny for five turns. When sunny, FIRE-type moves are more powerful.

Aeroblast.Description: A powerful FLYING-type attack. It often becomes a critical hit.

Drill Peck.Description: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is strong and highly likely to hit the target.

Fly.Description: The Pokémon flies high, then strikes in the next turn. Used to fly to places already visited.

Gust.Description: A FLYING-type attack. The bird Pokémon flaps its wings to create a powerful wind.

Mirror Move.Description: A move that strikes back with the opponent's last move. It comes after the enemy's move.

Peck.Description: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is favored by Pokémon with beaks or horns.

Sky Attack.Description: Strongest FLYING-type attack. Stores energy in the first turn, then fires in the next.

Wing Attack.Description: A FLYING-type attack. The attacking Pokémon spreads its wings and charges.

Confuse Ray.Description: A sinister flash of light makes the target confused. A special GHOST-type move.

Destiny Bond.Description: A move that causes the opponent to faint if the user faints after using this move.

Lick.Description: A GHOST-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of leaving the target with paralysis.

Night Shade.Description: A GHOST-type attack. Highly accurate, it always inflicts damage.

Nightmare.Description: A move that makes a sleeping target have bad dreams. The victim will steadily lose HP.

Shadow Ball.Description: A GHOST-type attack. Has a one-in-five chance of reducing the target's SPCL.DEF.

Spite.Description: A vengeful move that slightly reduces the PP of the opponent's last move.

Absorb.Description: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Cotton Spore.Description: Spores that cling to the target, sharply reducing the opponent's SPEED.

Giga Drain.Description: Half of the HP drained from the target is added to the attacker's HP.

Leech Seed.Description: Plants a seed on the target Pokémon. It slowly drains the target's HP for the attacker.

Mega Drain.Description: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Petal Dance.Description: A dance-like attack that lasts two to three turns. The attacker becomes confused.

Razor Leaf.Description: A GRASS-type attack that uses sharp-edged leaves. Likely to get a critical hit.

Sleep Powder.Description: Induces sleep. A Pokémon will stay asleep for several turns if an item isn't used to wake it.

SolarBeam.Description: Strongest GRASS-type attack. Energy is absorbed in the first turn, then fired on the next.

Spore.Description: Special spores are scattered from mushrooms. If the foe inhales them, it will fall asleep.

Stun Spore.Description: Special move that causes paralysis. The victim has a one-infour chance of immobility.

Synthesis.Description: Allows HP to be restored by the sunlight. In battle, half the user's max HP is restored.

Vine Whip.Description: A GRASS-type attack. The Pokémon uses its cruel whips to strike the opponent.

Bone Club.Description: A physical attack using a bone as a club. If it connects, it may cause the target to flinch.

Bone Rush.Description: A GROUND-type attack. The attacker uses a bone to club the foe two to five times.

Bonemerang.Description: A boomerang made of bone is thrown to inflict damage twice, on the way out and on return.

Dig.Description: The attacker digs underground in the first turn, then pops up in the next turn to attack.

Earthquake.Description: An attack that inflicts damage by shaking the ground. Useless against the FLYING type.

Fissure.Description: Causes a single-hit knockout if it hits. Useless against FLYING-type Pokémon.

Magnitude.Description: A GROUND-type attack. The power of the attack will vary each time it is used.

Mud-Slap.Description: An attack that fires dirt, inflicting damage and reducing the target's accuracy.

Sand-Attack.Description: An attack in which sand is used to blind the target and reduce its attack accuracy.

Spikes.Description: An attack that scatters SPIKES and injures opponent Pokémon when they switch.

Aurora Beam.Description: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of reducing the target's ATTACK power.

Blizzard.Description: The strongest ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target.

Haze.Description: Eliminates all changes affecting stats, such as SPEED, of both Pokémon in battle.

Ice Beam.Description: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

Ice Punch.Description: A special ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target.

Icy Wind.Description: An ICE-type attack. It is guaranteed to reduce the target's SPEED if it hits.

Mist.Description: Provides full protection against any enemy status attack.

Powder Snow.Description: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target.

Attract.Description: Infatuates targets, making it hard for them to attack foes of the opposite gender.

Barrage.Description: Several spheres are thrown consecutively at the target to inflict damage.

Baton Pass.Description: A move that transfers the user's status changes to the next Pokémon when switching.

Belly Drum.Description: A move that allows the user to consume half of its own HP in order to maximize its ATTACK.

Bide.Description: The user waits for several turns. At the end, it returns double the damage it received.

Bind.Description: Traps and squeezes the target over several turns. The target cannot move while under attack.

Body Slam.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target if it hits.

Charm.Description: A move that charms the target into complacency, sharply reducing its ATTACK power.

Comet Punch.Description: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

Constrict.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

Conversion.Description: A special move that switches the user's elemental type into one of the user's attack types.

Conversion 2.Description: A move that changes the user's type into one that is resistant to the opponent's last move.

Cut.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Also used for cutting small bushes to open new paths.

Defense Curl.Description: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Can normally be used up to six times in a row.

Disable.Description: A move that disables one of the target's moves. That move can't be used until it wears off.

Dizzy Punch.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-five chance of leaving the target confused.

DoubleSlap.Description: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

Double Team.Description: Creates illusionary copies of the user. They disorient the enemy, reducing its accuracy.

Double-Edge.Description: A charging tackle attack. One quarter of the damage comes back to hurt the attacker.

Egg Bomb.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. An egg is launched at the target. It may miss, however.

Encore.Description: Forces the target to continue to use the move it used last for the next two to six turns.

Endure.Description: Always leaves the user with at least one HP. Success rate decreases if used repeatedly.

Explosion.Description: The most powerful attack of all. However, the attacker faints after using this move.

ExtremeSpeed.Description: An attack that always strikes first. It can be learned by only a few Pokémon.

False Swipe.Description: A move that adjusts ATTACK so that the foe has one HP left. Can't cause the foe to faint.

Flail.Description: An attack that increases in power if the user's HP is low. It could turn the tide in battle.

Flash.Description: Blinds the target with a bright flash of light, reducing the opponent's accuracy.

Focus Energy.Description: Raises the likelihood of nailing the opponent's weak spot for a critical hit.

Foresight.Description: Neutralizes the foe's evasiveness. Also makes the GHOST type vulnerable to physical attacks.

Frustration.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. The more the user dislikes its trainer, the more powerful the move.

Fury Attack.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. The Pokémon rapidly jabs at its opponent several times.

Fury Swipes.Description: The target is scratched by sharp claws two to five times in quick succession.

Glare.Description: Transfixes the enemy with terrifying sharp eyes, frightening it into paralysis.

Growl.Description: A move that lowers the target's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

Growth.Description: A NORMAL-type move that raises SPCL.ATK. Normally used up to six times.

Guillotine.Description: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokémon that have large pincers.

Harden.Description: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Useful when battling physically strong Pokémon.

Headbutt.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it hits.

Heal Bell.Description: The soothing ringing of a bell that eliminates all status problems for the entire party.

Hidden Power.Description: A peculiar move that changes type and power depending on the Pokémon using it.

Horn Attack.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. A sharp horn is driven hard into the target to inflict damage.

Horn Drill.Description: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokémon with a horn or horns.

Hyper Beam.Description: An extremely powerful attack. The attacker becomes so tired, it has to rest the next turn.

Hyper Fang.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target flinch.

Leer.Description: A move that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokémon.

Lock-On.Description: An attack that locks on to the target to ensure that the next attack will hit without fail.

Lovely Kiss.Description: A special move that puts the target to sleep with a big kiss. (Actually, the victim faints.)

Mean Look.Description: A probing stare that prevents the target from escaping until the attacking Pokémon is gone.

Mega Kick.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Out of all the Pokémon kicking attacks, this is the strongest.

Mega Punch.Description: A NORMAL-type attack move. It is highly accurate and relatively powerful.

Metronome.Description: The user waggles its finger, triggering a move. There is no telling what will happen.

Milk Drink.Description: A move that restores HP by half of the user's max HP. This move may also be used in the field.

Mimic.Description: A move for learning one of the opponent's moves, for use during that battle only.

Mind Reader.Description: It predicts the opponent's movement. The user's next attack will never miss.

Minimize.Description: Reduces the user's size and makes it harder to hit. Can normally be used up to six times.

Moonlight.Description: Allows HP to be restored by the moonlight. In battle, half the user's max HP is restored.

Morning Sun.Description: Allows HP to be restored by the morning sunlight. In battle, half the user's max HP is restored.

Pain Split.Description: A move that adds the HPs of the user and the target, then divides the total between them.

Pay Day.Description: A move that nets money at the end of battle. How much depends on attack frequency and level.

Perish Song.Description: A malevolent melody that causes both the user and the opponent to faint in three turns.

Pound.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Slightly stronger than TACKLE. Many Pokémon know this move.

Present.Description: A move that inflicts major damage but may restore the target's HP.

Protect.Description: Completely foils an opponent's attack. If used consecutively, its success rate decreases.

Psych Up.Description: Self-hypnosis move that copies the foe's stats changes, then applies them to the user.

Quick Attack.Description: Always strikes first. If both Pokémon use this, the one with higher SPEED attacks first.

Rage.Description: A non-stop attack move. The user's ATTACK power increases every time it sustains damage.

Rapid Spin.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. By spinning quickly, the user can escape from restraining moves.

Razor Wind.Description: A two-turn attack with the wind attack in the second turn. Learned by many FLYING types.

Recover.Description: Half of the user's maximum HP is restored. Few Pokémon learn this move on their own.

Return.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. The tamer the user, the more powerful the move.

Roar.Description: A terrifying roar that drives the target away. The opposing trainer must use a new Pokémon.

Safeguard.Description: A mystic power that protects the user from status problems for five turns.

Scary Face.Description: A horrific look that scares the victim, sharply reducing the target's SPEED.

Scratch.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Sharp claws are used to inflict damage on the target.

Screech.Description: A move that makes a horrible noise. It sharply reduces the target's DEFENSE.

Selfdestruct.Description: The user explodes, damaging the enemy, then faints. Useless against the GHOST type.

Sharpen.Description: Raises the user's ATTACK power. The edges of the Pokémon are made harder for more impact.

Sing.Description: A special NORMAL-type move. A soothing melody lulls the target to sleep.

Sketch.Description: A move that allows the user to copy a move used by an opponent and learn that move.

Skull Bash.Description: In the first turn, the attacker tucks its head. The next turn, it head-butts at full steam.

Slam.Description: A NORMAL-type attack move. The attacker uses an appendage to slam the target hard.

Slash.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. It has a high probability of a critical hit for inflicting double damage.

Sleep Talk.Description: Randomly chooses one of the user's moves. Can be used only by a sleeping Pokémon.

SmokeScreen.Description: Creates an obscuring cloud of smoke that reduces the enemy's accuracy.

Snore.Description: Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch. Can be used only by a sleeping Pokémon.

Softboiled.Description: Half of the user's maximum HP is restored. May also be used in the field.

SonicBoom.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. It always inflicts a set amount of damage.

Spike Cannon.Description: A physical attack consisting of two to five consecutive hits. Highly accurate.

Splash.Description: A move that involves only flopping and SPLASHing around. It has no effect.

Stomp.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it hits.

Strength.Description: A very powerful NORMAL-type attack. Also used for moving obstacles like boulders.

Struggle.Description: Used only if the user is totally out of PP. The user is hit with 1/4 the damage it inflicts.

Substitute.Description: Uses 1/4 of the user's maximum HP to create a substitute that takes the opponent's attacks.

Super Fang.Description: If it hits, this attack cuts the target's HP in half. Learned by Pokémon with developed fangs.

Supersonic.Description: A special NORMAL-type move. Supersonic sound waves are used to confuse the target.

Swagger.Description: A move that infuriates and confuses the opponent, but it increases the target's ATTACK.

Sweet Kiss.Description: A sweet little kiss that causes the target to become giddy and confused.

Sweet Scent.Description: A pleasant aroma that distracts the target, making the opponent easier to hit.

Swift.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. It is highly accurate, so it can be counted on to inflict damage.

Swords Dance.Description: A special move that boosts the user's ATTACK power. Normally used up to three times.

Tackle.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. Many Pokémon know this attack right from the start.

Tail Whip.Description: A move that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokémon.

Take Down.Description: A charging attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

Thrash.Description: An attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker becomes confused.

Transform.Description: Transforms user into a copy of the target, including the type. All moves have only five PP each.

Tri Attack.Description: A NORMAL-type attack. A triangular field of energy is created and launched.

ViceGrip.Description: A NORMAL-type attack used only by Pokémon with pincers. The target is gripped and injured.

Whirlwind.Description: A powerful wind that blows the target away. The opposing trainer must use a new Pokémon.

Wrap.Description: Traps and squeezes the target over two to five turns, making the target unable to move.

Acid.Description: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of lowering the target's DEFENSE.

Acid Armor.Description: Melts the user's body for protection. A move that sharply raises DEFENSE.

Poison Gas.Description: A poisonous cloud of gas is forcefully expelled to poison the target.

Poison Sting.Description: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of leaving the target poisoned.

PoisonPowder.Description: A move that poisons the target. If poisoned, the victim loses HP steadily.

Sludge.Description: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of poisoning the target.

Sludge Bomb.Description: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of leaving the target poisoned.

Smog.Description: Smog is spewed as a cloud. Has a fifty-fifty chance of poisoning the target.

Toxic.Description: A move that badly poisons the target. The amount of poison damage increases every turn.

Agility.Description: A special move that greatly boosts the user's SPEED. Normally used up to three times.

Amnesia.Description: A move that increases the user's SPCL.DEF stat. It is normally used up to three times.

Barrier.Description: Instantly forms a barrier between the user and the opponent. DEFENSE is increased.

Confusion.Description: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target confused.

Dream Eater.Description: Works only on sleeping Pokémon. Steals the target's HP and adds 50%% of it to the user's HP.

Future Sight.Description: A special PSYCHIC-type attack. It strikes the target two turns after it is used.

Hypnosis.Description: A special PSYCHIC-type move. The target is hypnotized into a deep sleep.

Kinesis.Description: A special move of bending spoons to confound the enemy. Makes the user harder to hit.

Light Screen.Description: Reduces damage from special attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type move.

Meditate.Description: A special move that boosts the user's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

Mirror Coat.Description: The foe will receive double the damage the user sustained from a special attack. High accuracy.

Psybeam.Description: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target confused.

Psychic.Description: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of lowering the target's SPCL.DEF rating.

Psywave.Description: A PSYCHIC-type attack of varying intensity. It occasionally inflicts heavy damage.

Reflect.Description: Reduces damage from physical attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type move.

Rest.Description: The user takes a nap to fully restore its HP and recover from any status abnormalities.

Teleport.Description: A special move for instantly escaping from wild Pokémon. Useful in the wild only.

AncientPower.Description: A ROCK-type attack. This prehistoric move may boost all of the user's stats.

Rock Slide.Description: A ROCK-type attack that hits the target with an avalanche of rocks and boulders.

Rock Throw.Description: A ROCK-type attack. As the name implies, a huge boulder is dropped on the target.

Rollout.Description: Attacks for five turns, growing more powerful each time. Power returns to normal if it misses.

Sandstorm.Description: An attack that creates a sandstorm. The effect causes damage to both combatants.

Iron Tail.Description: Strikes the target with a stiff tail. Has a one-in-three shot at lowering the target's DEFENSE.

Metal Claw.Description: Strikes the target with sharp claws. Has a one-in-ten shot at raising the user's ATTACK.

Steel Wing.Description: Strikes the target with stiff wings. Has a one-in-ten chance of raising the user's DEFENSE.

Bubble.Description: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

BubbleBeam.Description: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

Clamp.Description: Grips the target in the attacker's shell for two to five turns.

Crabhammer.Description: A move that is used only by Pokémon with pincers. Likely to get a critical hit.

Hydro Pump.Description: The strongest WATER-type attack. While it is powerful, it may miss the target.

Octazooka.Description: An attack that shoots ink. Has a fifty-fifty chance of reducing the target's accuracy.

Rain Dance.Description: Summons rain for five turns. While it is raining, the power of WATER-type moves increases.

Surf.Description: A WATER-type attack. This move is strong and highly accurate.

Water Gun.Description: A WATER-type attack. Stronger than BUBBLE. Many WATER-type Pokémon learn this move.

Waterfall.Description: A WATER-type attack. Hits with a blow packing the power of fish traveling up waterfalls.

Whirlpool.Description: Lasts two to five turns. Foe becomes trapped in a vortex, making it impossible to switch.

Withdraw.Description: Used mainly by Pokémon with shells. By withdrawing into the shell, DEFENSE is increased.
